Package model

Class Poll

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.Poll

  • public class Poll
extends Object
    Version:
    iteration 1 The class Poll allows for the generation a named political poll which can contain multiple political parties (Party []). Each party contained within the poll has a unique name, projected number of seats and projected percentage of votes for that poll. Poll contains getters for the name of the poll, a specific party in the poll and number of total parties in the poll. The class has sorters which sort the poll by either seats won by each party or percentage of votes.
    Author:
    Dvij

      Creates and returns a part which is named 'Undetermined' and has the seats and percentage of votes not already accounted for by the sum of all the other parties in a poll

    • Constructor Detail

      • Poll

        public Poll​(String name,
            int maxNumberOfParties)
        The constructor generates a empty poll and assigns it the name provided. The Poll will contain the number of spots specified as long as the number if greater then or equal to 1.
        Parameters:
        name - Name which will be assigned to the poll
        maxNumberOfParties - The max number of parties which can be put into the poll

    • Method Detail

      • getPollName

        public String getPollName​()
        Getter for the name of the poll.
        Returns:
        The name of the poll

      • getNumberOfParties

        public int getNumberOfParties​()
        Getter for the number of parties in the poll.
        Returns:
        Number of parties in the poll.

      • addParty

        public void addParty​(Party aParty)
        Adds a party specified by the provided name to the end of the poll lit. Prints an error message if the party does not exists or if the poll is full. If a party already present in the poll has the same name as the one provided, the method replaces the old party with the new one.
        Parameters:
        aParty - The name of the party being added to the poll

      • getParty

        public Party getParty​(String name)
        Getter for a party within a poll.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the party looking to be obtained
        Returns:
        The party specified by the name if it exists, otherwise returns null.

      • getPartiesSortedBySeats

        public Party[] getPartiesSortedBySeats​()
        Sorts the parties in a poll by the number of seats won by each party from greatest to fewest and returns them as an list of parties (array party[])
        Returns:
        Array of Party[] which is sorted by number of seats won.

      • getPartiesSortedByVotes

        public Party[] getPartiesSortedByVotes​()
        Sorts the parties in a poll by the percentage of votes received by each party from greatest to fewest and returns them as an list of parties (array party[])
        Returns:
        Array of Party[] which is sorted by percentage of votes.

      • toString

        public String toString​()
        Convert the information contained within a poll to a string with format '(name)(newline)(string representation of first party)(newline) (string representation of second party)(newline)..."
        Overrides:

      • undeterminedVotesAndSeats

        public Party undeterminedVotesAndSeats​(int totalNumOfSeats)
        Creates and returns a part which is named 'Undetermined' and has the seats and percentage of votes not already accounted for by the sum of all the other parties in a poll
        Parameters:
        totalNumOfSeats - The number of seats which the poll encompasses
        Returns:
        A party with the number of seats and percentage of votes not accounted for in the poll.
